title: Tom Cotton
deleted: Cotton has long claimed to be an "Army Ranger" and as a graduate of the Army's [[Ranger School]] he is authorized to wear the Ranger tab. However, he has not served in the Army's [[75th Ranger Regiment]]. In 2021 an article by [[Salon (website)|Salon]] charged Cotton with saying he served as “a U.S. Army Ranger in Iraq and Afghanistan” and “volunteered to be an Army Ranger."<ref name=Salon>{{cite news|url=https://www.salon.com/2021/01/22/sen-tom-cotton-campaigned-on-his-experience-as-an-army-ranger--but-he-didnt-have-any/|title=Sen. Tom Cotton campaigned on his "experience as an Army Ranger" — but he didn't have any|author1=Roger Sollenberger|publisher=[[Salon (website)|Salon]]|date=January 23, 2021}}</ref> As a result of the article, Democratic Congressman [[Jason Crow]], who himself served in the 75th Ranger Regiment, sharply criticized Cotton for billing himself as a Ranger. In response, a spokesperson for Cotton said, "To be clear, as he's stated many times, Senator Cotton graduated from Ranger School, earned the Ranger Tab, and served a combat tour with the 101st Airborne, not the 75th Ranger Regiment."<ref>{{cite news |title='You shouldn't be calling yourself a Ranger': Tom Cotton's military service is under scrutiny from a fellow Army veteran in Congress |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/tom-cotton-ranger-military-service-jason-crow-2021-1 |access-date=January 24, 2021 |publisher=[[Business Insider]] |date=January 23, 2021}}</ref> As the Salon story garnered widespread attention, Command Sergeant Major Rick Merritt, a former regimental sergeant major of the 75th Ranger Regiment, defended Cotton's claim to be a Ranger, saying attacks on Cotton were "absurd", and that Cotton is "...100% a Ranger. He will always be a Ranger, it’s unfair, it’s almost slanderous. An attack on him is an attack on every veteran who has served honorably."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Lockwood |first1=Frank E. |title=Article questions Cotton's status as Army Ranger |url=https://www.arkansasonline.com/news/2021/jan/24/article-questions-cottons-status-as-army-ranger/ |website=[[Arkansas Democrat-Gazette]] |access-date=24 January 2021}}</ref>
